Package com.telos.loops.error

Class LoopsApiException

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Throwable
java.lang.Exception
java.lang.RuntimeException
com.telos.loops.error.LoopsApiException
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
RateLimitExceededException
public class LoopsApiException extends RuntimeException
Thrown when the Loops API returns an error response.

This exception is raised for all HTTP error responses (4xx, 5xx status codes) returned by the Loops API. It captures the HTTP status code, raw response body, and parsed error message for detailed error handling.

Common Scenarios

  • 400 Bad Request: Invalid request parameters or malformed JSON
  • 401 Unauthorized: Invalid or missing API key
  • 404 Not Found: Resource not found
  • 429 Too Many Requests: Rate limit exceeded (see RateLimitExceededException)
  • 500 Internal Server Error: Server-side error

Example Usage


 LoopsClient client = LoopsClient.builder()
         .apiKey("your-api-key")
         .build();

 try {
     client.contacts().create(request);
 } catch (LoopsApiException e) {
     System.err.println("API Error: " + e.getMessage());
     System.err.println("Status Code: " + e.statusCode());
     System.err.println("Error: " + e.error());
     System.err.println("Raw Body: " + e.rawBody());
 } catch (LoopsValidationException e) {
     System.err.println("Validation Error: " + e.getMessage());
 }

Retry Behavior

This exception does not trigger automatic retries. For rate limit errors (HTTP 429), a RateLimitExceededException is thrown instead, which includes retry-after information.

See Also:
  • RateLimitExceededException
  • LoopsValidationException

  • Constructor Details

    • LoopsApiException

      public LoopsApiException(String message)
      Constructs a new LoopsApiException with a custom message.

      This constructor is used for generic error conditions where no HTTP response is available.

      Parameters:
      message - the error message

    • LoopsApiException

      public LoopsApiException(int statusCode, String rawBody)
      Constructs a new LoopsApiException from an HTTP error response.

      The error message is automatically extracted from the response body's "message" or "error" field if present, otherwise defaults to "HTTP {statusCode}".

      Parameters:
      statusCode - the HTTP status code from the error response
      rawBody - the raw response body as a string

  • Method Details

    • statusCode

      public int statusCode()
      Returns the HTTP status code from the error response.

      Returns 0 if the exception was constructed without an HTTP response.

      Returns:
      the HTTP status code, or 0 if not applicable

    • rawBody

      public String rawBody()
      Returns the raw response body from the API.

      This can be useful for debugging or logging the full error response.

      Returns:
      the raw response body, or null if not available

    • error

      public String error()
      Returns the parsed error message from the response body.

      This is extracted from the "error" field in the JSON response if present.

      Returns:
      the error message, or null if not available
